DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Studying sample tumor tissue patient cancer laboratory may help doctor learn change may occur RNA identify biomarkers related cancer . PURPOSE : This research study collect analyze lung tissue sample patient undergo surgery non-small cell lung cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Collecting Analyzing Tissue Samples From Patients Undergoing Surgery Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Develop statistical computational method model relationship multiple variable protein RNA expression data clinical endpoint use supervise unsupervised classification pattern recognition approach . - Determine protein RNA expression fingerprint completely resect non-small cell lung cancer without prior chemotherapy . - Correlate protein RNA expression fingerprint T-stage nodal involvement time surgery , collect outcome data allow correlation recurrence ( local and/or distant ) survival . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . Any excess tissue remove surgery would otherwise discard ( tissue use diagnosis and/or treatment decision making ) obtain study . Tissue analyze molecular feature predict biologic behavior . Quantitation RNA , gene expression profile , protein expression pattern assess matrix-assisted laser desorption/ionization time flight mass spectroscopy microarray analysis . Medical record review obtain information result test associate cancer diagnosis . Further progress cancer treatment tumor behavior surgery follow via record review .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion Diagnosis nonsmall cell lung cancer Clinical stage I II disease Resectable disease complete surgical resection plan Treated companion study Vanderbilt University , Veterans Administration hospital , St. Thomas , VanderbiltIngram Cancer Center Affiliate Network Tumor specimen sample must available resection Exclusion criterion Chemotherapy surgery Radiotherapy surgery
DOC.keyword: stage I non-small cell lung cancer
stage II non-small cell lung cancer
